This study showed that prevalence of L monocytogenes in shrimp and fresh fish samples taken in the Kashan region, was low (0.94%). Previous studies in other areas in Iran have been demonstrated as follows; 7.8% of open-air fish market samples in Mazandaran,
8 0% and 1.9% of fresh fish, frozen fish, and shrimp samples in Isfahan and Shahrekord, respectively.
10, 20 Also, our findings are similar to Momtaz and Yadollahi
27 who revealed 2.5% (1 sample) L monocytogenes contamination in fresh shrimp in Iran. Zarei et al
28 reported the low prevalence of L monocytogenes in Iranian seafood samples (1.4%). Latorre et al
29 reported that L monocytogenes was not found in 154 samples of fresh seafood products in Italy.
